N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 469.5 - Rights and privileges

State Regulations

Temporarily reappointed members shall not be permanent
employees of the division, and will not be entitled to the rights, benefits and
privileges accorded to permanent members. Reappointed members are temporary
employees who may be appointed and may be dismissed without a hearing at the
discretion of the superintendent. A general listing of temporarily reappointed
members' rights, privileges, and limitations are as follows: (a) temporarily reappointed members' date of
entry will be the date of reappointment; (b) temporarily reappointed members will
accrue sick leave on a monthly basis, but will not have access to any sick
leave accruals that existed at the time of their retirement and will be
ineligible for sick leave at half-pay; (c) temporarily reappointed members will
accrue annual and personal leave. The date the reappointed member is rehired
will be the personal leave anniversary date; (d) temporarily reappointed members will not
be members of any retirement system during the period of temporary employment, but will continue to receive their existing pension without an earnings
limitation if authorized by law. As temporarily reappointed members are not
members of the retirement system, they are ineligible for disability retirement
or retirement system death benefits; (e) temporarily reappointed members will not
be eligible for leave under regulation 5.12 of the NYS Police Administrative

Manual; (f) temporarily reappointed
members generally will follow the work schedules provided in article
8F; (g) temporarily reappointed
members shall not retain their original division date of entry and shall have
seniority only among themselves for the purpose of vacation
scheduling; (h) temporarily
reappointed members are not eligible for modified duty, but must be fit for
full and strenuous duty at all times; and
(i) temporarily reappointed members shall not
be eligible for promotional opportunities. Notes
